activities.loc: JCB Check Monitor & Posted Calendar for Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mary E Berning

records.addlTxt:
8:40 AM Defendant Mary E Berning in court.  Attorney Andrew Joseph Harrington in court for Mary E Berning.  Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter appears by zoom video.

8:40  Court relates and gives appearances.
8:41  Detective Jacob Winkler called, sworn, direct by State.  Witness identifies defendant.
8:50  Cross by Atty. Harrington.
8:54  Court finds probable cause on counts #1, 2,and 3; bound over.
Arraignment set; must appear in person.
Arraignment scheduled for January 6, 2023 at 10:00 am.

10:03 AM Defendant Mary E Berning in court.  Attorney Andrew Joseph Harrington in court for Mary E Berning.  Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

COVERS 22CF193 & 22CM53

22CF193- Attorney Harrington waives reading and request Preliminary hearing and waives time limits. 
Bond to continue. 

22CM53- JT to proceed.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

11:17 AM Defendant Mary E Berning appeared by video.  Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

11:17  Court relates and gives appearances.  Court appoints Atty. Harrington to this case as well.  Defendant to call Atty. Harrington and inform him he's been appointed to this case.  Defendant to stop at Clerk of Court's office on Friday to add this case to the wage assignment she is currently on.
Court adjourns to Friday at 10:00 am.
Bond to continue.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 14, 2022 at 11:00 am.

1:00 PM Defendant Mary E Berning appeared by video, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Brady James Seidlitz in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Alex Kitto appeared by video for Mary E Berning. 
Court relates.  Defendant needs to call public defender's office to apply.  
Next hearing to be by zoom in front of Judge Bitney.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.
